intro: Paraboea prolixa, commonly known as the slender paraboea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Paraboea prolixa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
